info.title: Skywatch Subscription API doc for DH

plan_id.description: ID of a plan. Format: plan-yyyymmddHHmmssSSS

shopify_subscription_id.description: ID of a Subscription of Shopify

subscription_id.description: ID of a subscription. Format: sub-yyyymmddHHmmssSSS-xxxxxxxx

updated_at.description: The date/time of last update to the subscription, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

channels.description: array of channels of device, when device not supported multiple channel, that only have one value.

items.description: index of channel

retention.description: Default retention period for all types of recordings, in day.

resolution.description: Max resolution included in a plan, in user-friendly term.

number.description: The max number of video uploads per day.

items.description: Types of recordings included in a plan.

retention.description: Retention period for this specific type and it overwrites the default retention period if presented. In day.

cap_per_day.description: Default **total** number of attachments, including all types, per recipient per day. It's reset at midnight every day of device local time.

items.description: Types of attachments included in a plan. If omitted or empty, means no attachment in the notificaiton but only text.

cap_per_day.description: Max number of this particular type of attachment included in a plan.
Max number of this particular type of attachment included in a plan.
Max number of this particular type of attachment included in a plan.
Max number of this particular type of attachment included in a plan.

interval.description: The min interval between two events per type, in second. Value 0 means no limit.

event_number.description: The max number of events a day that would be stored in the database.

thumbnail_number.description: The max number of thumbnails a day that would be stored in the database.

type.description: Types of events included in a plan.

retention.description: Default retention period for all included types of events, in day.

channels.description: Number of channels included in a plan. **NOTE** if *channels* is greater than 1, in order for users to be able to assign the channels to a multi-channel device (recorder), the *cross_devices* **MUST** set to true.

cross_devices.description: Whether the channels could be enabled across devices. Say a plan includes 2 channels, if cross_devices is set to true, user may assign one channel to one device and another channel to another device; whereas if cross_devices is false, then all channels have to be assigned to same device.

device_models.description: The devices to which orders can be sold, when empty, means support for all devices.

UnSubscriptionDateTimeAt.description: The date/time of unsubscription, if the this field is reached, regardless of the status, it will be considered as the end of the subscription, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
